title: [compass-engine] Phase 4: Implement distribution mechanisms
description:
Implement three distribution mechanisms for compass-engine content.

**Mechanism 1: Installer Integration (Primary)**
- New step in compass-brand-setup: setup-compass-engine.js
- Location: After clone-workspace, before setup-vscode
- Behavior: Build engine, copy dist/.claude/ to projects
- Preserve local-only paths (settings.local.json, scratchpad/, commands/local/)

**Mechanism 2: NPM Package (Secondary)**
- Package: @compass-brand/compass-engine
- Contains: dist/.claude/, scripts/, bin/push.js
- Commands: compass-engine push, compass-engine push --all

**Mechanism 3: Direct Sync Script (Tertiary)**
- Script: src/scripts/workflow/sync-from-engine.sh
- Pull from compass-engine to current project
- Support --force flag for full overwrite

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Installer step distributes to all projects
- [ ] NPM package can be installed and used
- [ ] Sync script works standalone
- [ ] Local-only content preserved in all mechanisms

title: [compass-engine] Phase 5: Implement sync strategy (full replacement)
description:
Implement full replacement sync strategy instead of merge.

**Why Full Replacement:**
- Ensures bug fixes propagate (merge would leave bugs in place)
- Simpler to understand and debug
- No conflict resolution needed

**Sync Algorithm:**
1. Backup local-only content (settings.local.json, scratchpad/, commands/local/)
2. Delete target .claude/ entirely
3. Copy fresh from dist/.claude/
4. Restore local-only content from backup

**Local-Only Paths (preserved):**
- .claude/settings.local.json
- .claude/scratchpad/
- .claude/commands/local/

**Implementation Files:**
- src/utils/engine-sync.js (in compass-brand-setup)
- scripts/push.sh (in compass-engine)

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Full replacement works correctly
- [ ] Local-only content always preserved
- [ ] No remnants of old content after sync
- [ ] Rollback possible if sync fails

title: [compass-engine] Epic: Transform bmad-engine to compass-engine
description:
Epic tracking the full transformation of bmad-engine into compass-engine - the central development tools repository for all Compass Brand projects.

**Goal:**
Transform bmad-engine into compass-engine, the central hub for:
- Claude Code configuration (agents, commands, skills, rules, hooks)
- BMAD customizations (modified workflows, custom agents)
- Claude Code customizations (system prompts, settings)
- Workflow scripts (all development automation)
- Distribution tooling (build and push mechanisms)

**Phases:**
- Phase 0: Fix BMAD acronym in documentation
- Phase 1: GitHub repository rename
- Phase 2: Create source structure, migrate content
- Phase 3: Implement build system
- Phase 4: Implement distribution mechanisms
- Phase 5: Implement sync strategy (full replacement)
- Phase 6: Write documentation
- Phase 7: Update compass-brand-setup installer
- Phase 8: Migrate scripts from compass-brand
- Phase 9: Testing and verification

**Key Decisions:**
- Build step compiles src/ to dist/.claude/
- Full replacement sync (not merge) to ensure bug fixes propagate
- Three distribution mechanisms: installer, NPM package, sync script
- Local-only paths preserved: settings.local.json, scratchpad/, commands/local/

**BMAD Acronym:**
Official: Breakthrough Method of Agile AI-Driven Development
(NOT Business Model Aligned Development)

**Estimated Time:** 2-3 days

title: [compass-engine] Phase 3: Implement build system
description:
Create the build system that compiles src/ into dist/.claude/

**Build Script (scripts/build.js):**
1. Clean dist/ directory
2. Copy src/claude/* to dist/.claude/
3. Merge src/scripts/claude/hooks into dist/.claude/scripts/
4. Generate settings.json from templates
5. Validate output structure

**Package.json Scripts:**
- npm run build - Run build.js
- npm run validate - Validate dist/ output
- npm run clean - Clean dist/

**Output Structure (dist/.claude/):**
- agents/
- commands/ (with bmad/ subfolder)
- skills/
- rules/
- contexts/
- config/
- scripts/hooks/
- settings.json
- hooks.md, lsp.json, README.md

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] npm run build produces valid dist/.claude/
- [ ] All required files present in output
- [ ] settings.json is valid JSON
- [ ] Build is idempotent (running twice gives same result)
